text:
I am currently often extracting submatrices of large sparse matrices `A[i,j]`  and passing them on to other processes. (I am writing a sparse direct solver/multifrontal method)

These submatrices are often just zero-matrices or sometimes not sparse enough for `A[i,j]`  to be efficient, so instead I run `Matrix(view(A, i, j))` . Is there some Julia-way of smartly selecting the best representation and using that? I would be happy if I could smartly choose between Fill-matrices for 0-blocks, sparse matrices and dense matrices. (I am not even sure Fill-matrices have a big benefit over sparse matrices with 0 entries)
